byline.original: By KATIE BENNER and ERIC LICHTBLAU
byline.contributor: Katie Benner reported from San Francisco and Eric Lichtblau from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The Justice Department announcement, in a court filing, ends an immediate legal battle over the San Bernardino shooting case but raises questions about Apple’s security.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Says It Has Unlocked  an iPhone Without Apple
headline.main: U.S. Says It Has Unlocked iPhone Without Apple

snippet: The Justice Department announcement, in a court filing, ends an immediate legal battle over the San Bernardino shooting case but raises questions about Apple’s security.
abstract: Justice Dept says it has found way to unlock iPhone of San Bernardino, Calif, shooter without help from Apple, allowing agency to withdraw its legal effort to compel tech company to assist in investigation; law enforcement's ability to open phone, and fact that it may classify method, raises questions about security of Apple devices and creates potential new conflicts between firm and government.
